title: Technique
data:
**Techniques** are special abilities in [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), [SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM"), pre-[rewrite](/wiki/SpliceHack-Rewrite "SpliceHack-Rewrite") versions of [SpliceHack](/wiki/SpliceHack "SpliceHack") and [Hack'EM](/wiki/Hack%27EM "Hack'EM").

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Description](#Description)
  - [1.1 Limit mode](#Limit_mode)

- [2 Role dependent](#Role_dependent)

  - [2.1 Archeologist](#Archeologist)
  - [2.2 Barbarian](#Barbarian)
  - [2.3 Caveman](#Caveman)
  - [2.4 Flame mage](#Flame_mage)
  - [2.5 Healer](#Healer)
  - [2.6 Ice mage](#Ice_mage)
  - [2.7 Knight](#Knight)
  - [2.8 Monk](#Monk)
  - [2.9 Necromancer](#Necromancer)
  - [2.10 Priest](#Priest)
  - [2.11 Ranger](#Ranger)
  - [2.12 Rogue](#Rogue)
  - [2.13 Samurai](#Samurai)
  - [2.14 Tourist](#Tourist)
  - [2.15 Undead slayer](#Undead_slayer)
  - [2.16 Valkyrie](#Valkyrie)
  - [2.17 Wizard](#Wizard)
  - [2.18 Yeoman](#Yeoman)

- [3 Race dependent](#Race_dependent)

  - [3.1 Doppelganger](#Doppelganger)
  - [3.2 Dwarf](#Dwarf)
  - [3.3 Gnome](#Gnome)
  - [3.4 Hobbit](#Hobbit)
  - [3.5 Lycanthrope](#Lycanthrope)
  - [3.6 Vampire](#Vampire)
  - [3.7 Orc](#Orc)

- [4 Other](#Other)

- [5 Technique skill level](#Technique_skill_level)

- [6 SpliceHack](#SpliceHack)

- [7 See also](#See_also)

- [8 References](#References)

## Description

A technique can be used with the **#technique** [extended command](/wiki/Extended_command "Extended command"), and many of them have a cooldown period before they can be used again. Most techniques are specific to certain roles or certain playable races - the [disarm](/wiki/Disarm_\(technique\) "Disarm (technique)") technique is a common exception.

### Limit mode

If you are under 1⁄10 HP, you may enter limit mode, which appears as LIMIT on your game screen. Using a prepared technique while in limit mode does not trigger a cooldown period, allowing it to be used again the next turn. Techniques that have not yet recovered from a previous usage can be activated under limit mode, but *only* if the [menustyle option](/wiki/Options#menustyle "Options") is set to "traditional" – this is probably a bug.

Limit mode usually activates about 8⁄15 of the time, based on "a simple pseudorandom number generator"[\[1\]](#cite_note-1) - limit mode can be reliably activated if your HP is reduced to exactly 1, and you have at least 11 maximum HP.

|           |                                                |
| --------- | ---------------------------------------------- |
| **Level** | **Technique**                                  |

### Dwarf

|           |                                                      |
| --------- | ---------------------------------------------------- |

| --------- | ------------------------------- |

| --------- | ---------------------------- |

|           |                                                              |

### Vampire

|           |                                             |

| **Level** | **Technique**                               |

### Orc

None.

## Other

|           |                                                           |
| --------- | --------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Level** | **Technique**                                             |
| 1         | [Disarm](/wiki/Disarm_\(technique\) "Disarm (technique)") |

## Technique skill level

Some of the techniques' effects are dependent on the players skill in this technique. For example a [Doppelganger](/wiki/Doppelganger "Doppelganger") using their [liquid leap](/wiki/Liquid_leap "Liquid leap") technique is able to leap a further distance the more skilled they are in that technique.

When a player first acquires a technique, that technique's skill level is set to 1.[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)[\[3\]](#cite_note-3) For every [experience level](/wiki/Experience_level "Experience level") the player gains, the skill level of techniques they already know will increase.[\[4\]](#cite_note-4)

## SpliceHack

Early versions of [SpliceHack](/wiki/SpliceHack "SpliceHack") had techniques. They were removed in version 1.0.0, making techniques a [defunct feature in SpliceHack](/wiki/Defunct_features_\(SpliceHack\) "Defunct features (SpliceHack)").

## See also

- [Vernon Spoiler on techniques](http://www.juiblex.co.uk/nethack/VernonSpoilers/tech-006e4.txt)
- [Source:SLASH'EM\_0.0.7E7F2/tech.c](/wiki/Source:SLASH%27EM_0.0.7E7F2/tech.c "Source:SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2/tech.c") defines all the techniques except dragon polyself.

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [tech.c in SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2, line 196](/wiki/Source:SLASH%27EM_0.0.7E7F2/tech.c#line196 "Source:SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2/tech.c")
2. [↑](#cite_ref-2) [tech.h in SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2, line 32](/wiki/Source:SLASH%27EM_0.0.7E7F2/tech.h#line32 "Source:SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2/tech.h")
3. [↑](#cite_ref-3) [tech.c in SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2, line 86](/wiki/Source:SLASH%27EM_0.0.7E7F2/tech.c#line86 "Source:SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2/tech.c")
4. [↑](#cite_ref-4) [tech.c in SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2, line 190](/wiki/Source:SLASH%27EM_0.0.7E7F2/tech.c#line190 "Source:SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2/tech.c")

Technique

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search

Techniques are special abilities in SLASH'EM, SlashTHEM, pre-rewrite versions of SpliceHack and Hack'EM.

Contents

  • 1 Description
    • 1.1 Limit mode
  • 2 Role dependent
    • 2.1 Archeologist

  • 4 Other

  • 6 SpliceHack
  • 7 See also
  • 8 References

Description

A technique can be used with the #technique extended command, and many of them have a cooldown period before they can be used again. Most techniques are specific to certain roles or certain playable races - the disarm technique is a common exception.

Limit mode

If you are under 1⁄10 HP, you may enter limit mode, which appears as LIMIT on your game screen. Using a prepared technique while in limit mode does not trigger a cooldown period, allowing it to be used again the next turn. Techniques that have not yet recovered from a previous usage can be activated under limit mode, but only if the menustyle option is set to "traditional" – this is probably a bug.

Limit mode usually activates about 8⁄15 of the time, based on "a simple pseudorandom number generator"[1] - limit mode can be reliably activated if your HP is reduced to exactly 1, and you have at least 11 maximum HP.

When a player first acquires a technique, that technique's skill level is set to 1.[2][3] For every experience level the player gains, the skill level of techniques they already know will increase.[4]

SpliceHack

Early versions of SpliceHack had techniques. They were removed in version 1.0.0, making techniques a defunct feature in SpliceHack.

'''Techniques''' are special abilities in [[SLASH'EM]], [[SlashTHEM]], pre-[[SpliceHack-Rewrite|rewrite]] versions of [[SpliceHack]] and [[Hack'EM]].

==Description==
A technique can be used with the '''#technique''' [[extended command]], and many of them have a cooldown period before they can be used again. Most techniques are specific to certain roles or certain playable races - the [[Disarm (technique)|disarm]] technique is a common exception.

===Limit mode===
If you are under {{frac|10}} HP, you may enter limit mode, which appears as LIMIT on your game screen. Using a prepared technique while in limit mode does not trigger a cooldown period, allowing it to be used again the next turn. Techniques that have not yet recovered from a previous usage can be activated under limit mode, but ''only'' if the [[Options#menustyle|menustyle option]] is set to "traditional" – this is probably a bug.

Limit mode usually activates about {{frac|8|15}} of the time, based on "a simple pseudorandom number generator"{{refsrc|tech.c|196|version=SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2}} - limit mode can be reliably activated if your HP is reduced to exactly 1, and you have at least 11 maximum HP.

== Technique skill level ==
Some of the techniques' effects are dependent on the players skill in this technique. For example a [[Doppelganger]] using their [[liquid leap]] technique is able to leap a further distance the more skilled they are in that technique.

When a player first acquires a technique, that technique's skill level is set to 1.{{refsrc|tech.h|32|version=SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2}}{{refsrc|tech.c|86|version=SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2}} For every [[experience level]] the player gains, the skill level of techniques they already know will increase.{{refsrc|tech.c|190|version=SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2}}

== SpliceHack ==
Early versions of [[SpliceHack]] had techniques. They were removed in version 1.0.0, making techniques a [[defunct features (SpliceHack)|defunct feature in SpliceHack]].
